result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M. Hurst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Eau Claire County prison sentence
Concurrent with: Jackson County case 13CF73

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Must seek and maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must comply with any other recommendations for treatment or programming deemed appropriate by your probation agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From DOC requesting clarification on probation term.
I entered this event a 2nd time in error and the system will not let me erase it.  I called CCAP and they cannot do a data fix.  They said to just enter a note as to why it's entered twice.

ADDRESS INFO for Austin M. Hurst
Current: P.O. Box 700, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2015)
Prior: W11991 Hwy 10, Fairchild, WI 54741

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant has already plead to 13CF73.  Victim notification has been complied with.  There is a joint recommendation:  14CF175 - reviewed waiver of prelim form and rights to preliminary hearing with defendant.  Finds defendant knowingly and intelligently waived right to preliminary hearing.  Bound over for trial.  State filed an Information; defense waived the reading.  Court reviews charges and penalties with defendant.  Enters plea of guilty to Count 1.  Court reviews plea questionnaire/wavier of rights/charges & penalties with defendant.  Court finds the defendant understands the proceedings, FVI waives rights and enters plea; factual basis exists and finding of guilty.  Count 2 in 14CF175 is dismissed and read-in; and 14CF176 is dismissed and read-in.  Sentenced to 3 years probation on both cases with conditions.  13CF73 and 14CF175 are to be consecutive to current Eau Claire County prison sentence and 14CF175 is concurrent with 13CF73.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant did not appear, Attorney Poss appeared and advised the court that the defendant is currently in custody in the La Crosse County Jail.  Defense to advise when defendant will be released.  DA may request warrants.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Poss appeared on defendant's behalf.

Bond to cover 14CF175 and 14CF176. Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Ashley G.
